commits.message:
Fix fly-to example (#1872)

Co-authored-by: Mai Mai <mai.mai@mapbox.com>

Cross-check for pinned dependencies versions during sanity check (#1845)

* Check for common version match during the sanity check

* Check for pinned dependencies versions during the sanity check

* Remove v from turf version pin

* Fail sanity check if pins are different

* Fetch common version fro GL Native snapshots properly

* Improve semantic version regex so it can detect sem ver in the middle of the string

* Parse binary targets in Package.swift and include them to dependency search

* Improve error message when ResolvedPackage cannot find a pin for dependency

* Reinstate README.md for depsvalidator

* Reinstate core and common dependency validation barring Package.resolved

* Add common version cross-check as a depsvalidation manifest

* Match name of core maps binary target to the name of corresponding source control dependency

* Remove extra sanity check steps

* Restore back proper package naming

* Use path of common version cross check as its name

pull_request.title: Add accessibility voice over for map view.
pull_request.body: This adds accessibility label and hint for the map view. The android app provides voice over support for map view but is missing from the iOS app. ## Pull request checklist: - [x] Describe the changes in this PR, especially public API changes. - [ ] Include before/after visuals or gifs if this PR includes visual changes. - [ ] Write tests for all new functionality. Put tests in correct [Test Plan](https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-maps-ios/tree/main/Tests/TestPlans) (Unit, Integration, All) - [ ] If tests were not written, please explain why. - [ ] Add documentation comments for any added or updated public APIs. - [ ] Add any new public, top-level symbols to the Jazzy config's `custom_categories` (scripts/doc-generation/.jazzy.yaml) - [ ] Add a changelog entry to to bottom of the relevant section (typically the `## main` heading near the top). - [ ] Update the guides (internal access only), README.md, and DEVELOPING.md if their contents are impacted by these changes. - [ ] If this PR is a `v10.[version]` release branch fix / enhancement, merge it to `main` first and then port to `v10.[version]` release branch. PRs must be submitted under the terms of our Contributor License Agreement [CLA](https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-maps-ios/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#contributor-license-agreement).

comment.body: Hi! Thank you for submitting this pull request, improving accessibility of mapbox map is something that we have in our work backlog, I'm closing this PR in favor of that task, feel free to set the required accessibility strings on your side meanwhile.

pull_request.title: Fixed ambiguous 'Polygon' type error for Mac Catalyst target
pull_request.body:
This Pull Request fixes #1997 

:warning: ```PolygonAnnotation.swift``` is a generated file. I am not aware about the generation process. The fix needs to be applied to the source file whatsoever.

https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-maps-ios/blob/58af389f41ba9aa9e019e83d261e207e6a9d9be4/Sources/MapboxMaps/Annotations/Generated/PolygonAnnotation.swift#L1

comment.body: Hi! Thanks for submitting this PR, currently we are not supporting Mac Catalyst platform, we will be considering adding the support in the upcoming versions.

issue.title: Slow initial map bootstrapping
issue.body:
## Environment

- Xcode version: 14.3.1
- iOS version: iOS 16.4
- Devices affected: iOS and Android devices
- Maps SDK Version: 10.16.0

## Observed behavior and steps to reproduce
The initial map bootstrapping time depends on the offline db size. As bigger the size is, as longer it takes to render the map.
For instance:
 - [no download regions](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1XI5Z6ssUbRzyqcUd0DZPKmKMBzmEfK-F/view?usp=sharing): almost instant bootstrap
 - [several regions downloaded](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1N8oeAm85qwA8FpjkwtwZYDMw5hrOKkNR/view?usp=sharing) with ~2Gb size in total: ~8s

## Expected behavior

Initial bootstrapping should not depend on the map_data.db size. Could you confirm whether it's expected or not? 

## Notes / preliminary analysis

1. This is only reproducible in **Online mode**
2. During bootstrapping phase, `map_data.db-journal` appears in`.mapbox/map_data` folder. The map is ready only when that file is gone
3. In **Offline mode** map renders instantly

commits.message: Fix inset safea area ignore option in SwiftUI

Bugfix/mapsios 1082 puck images updates (#1859)

* Update puck 2D's images on changed
- Compare images before and after configuration changes and add new images if needed.
- Puck2DRenderer no longer resolves shadowImage, instead it will use the image from Puck2DConfiguration, allow users to disable shadowImage.

issue.title: Annotations positions and order
Annotations positions and order
Multiple calls to .insets() inconsistent results SwiftUI
issue.body:
## Environment

- Xcode version: 15
- iOS version: 17
- Devices affected: iPhone 15 pro
- Maps SDK Version: 11.0.0-beta.5

## Observed behavior and steps to reproduce

When initially setting a viewport with insets, the viewport is displayed as expected.

`self.viewport = .overview(geometry: route.lineString).inset(edges: .all, length: 30)`

![initial](https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-maps-ios/assets/1065234/fbc8c1f6-6154-448d-a58c-cc50f68f7e68)

Changing the viewport seems to then work as expected:

`self.viewport = .followPuck(zoom: 18).inset(edges: .all, length: 30)`

![276748388-b4455940-8a83-46c1-94cf-6b44eb2e06b0](https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-maps-ios/assets/1065234/f129502f-aee8-4bb6-b5c0-1bd1044b94d5)

If the viewport is then changed back to the initial viewport, the insets are now different (notice how the polyline is approximately double the distance from the horizontal edges).

`self.viewport = .overview(geometry: route.lineString).inset(edges: .all, length: 30)`

![route](https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-maps-ios/assets/1065234/276acb1f-4d8c-4aaf-b90b-f57bccf6ed66)

## Expected behavior

The polyline ought to be in the same position upon both settings of the viewport, allowing developers to use insets to dodge UI elements, overlays etc whilst the focus of element(s) is consistent between viewport changes.

## Notes / preliminary analysis

Occurs whether or not viewport is animated

comment.body: Excellent! Thank you. I'll give the new beta a try asap

issue.title: Multiple calls to .insets() inconsistent results SwiftUI
issue.body:
## Environment

- Xcode version: 15
- iOS version: 17
- Devices affected: iPhone 15 pro
- Maps SDK Version: 11.0.0-beta.5

## Observed behavior and steps to reproduce

When initially setting a viewport with insets, the viewport is displayed as expected.

`self.viewport = .overview(geometry: route.lineString).inset(edges: .all, length: 30)`

![initial](https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-maps-ios/assets/1065234/fbc8c1f6-6154-448d-a58c-cc50f68f7e68)

Changing the viewport seems to then work as expected:

`self.viewport = .followPuck(zoom: 18).inset(edges: .all, length: 30)`

![276748388-b4455940-8a83-46c1-94cf-6b44eb2e06b0](https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-maps-ios/assets/1065234/f129502f-aee8-4bb6-b5c0-1bd1044b94d5)

If the viewport is then changed back to the initial viewport, the insets are now different (notice how the polyline is approximately double the distance from the horizontal edges).

`self.viewport = .overview(geometry: route.lineString).inset(edges: .all, length: 30)`

![route](https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-maps-ios/assets/1065234/276acb1f-4d8c-4aaf-b90b-f57bccf6ed66)

## Expected behavior

The polyline ought to be in the same position upon both settings of the viewport, allowing developers to use insets to dodge UI elements, overlays etc whilst the focus of element(s) is consistent between viewport changes.

## Notes / preliminary analysis

Occurs whether or not viewport is animated
